results.title: Developing more and better ideas
results.brief_description: A down-to-earth presentation of the process of developing ideas to help everyone, from top management to lowest rate employee, produce more and better ideas for cutting costs, increasing productivity, developing products and improving quality and performance.

results.title: Developing managerial talent
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Personnel Management”.
This film deals with the personnel side of management and enterprises where this function falls upon a particular manager. Discusses the recruiting and training of managers.

results.title: Devastation
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and National Films Council of the Motion Picture Industry
results.brief_description: A plea for the planting of trees throughout Australia to offset damage by bush fires and thoughtless timber cutters. Shows how tree destruction results in soil erosion, floods and water shortage but also how government planting of trees and voluntary planting by community groups can alleviate the problem.

results.title: Determination of molecular geometry: spectroscopic methods (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Concerned with the use of absorbtion spectra data in the calculation of structural information such as bond lengths, bond angles and bond strengths. The emphasis in the program is on the electrical characteristics of molecules which absorb electro-magnetic radiation, and how absorbtion in the microwave and infra-red regions of the spectra can be related to motions of the individual molecules.

results.title: Detect and protect
results.brief_description: The basic elements of the drug story. How do you spot whether or not your child, or any other child is using drugs? What are the tell-tale emotional changes to watch for? What are the various types of drugs and which are the most dangerous? How do you protect the youngsters against becoming part of the drug scene> This film answers these questions simply.

results.title: War on warrens
results.creator_credit: Roy Violer, Department of Agriculture and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rabbit Control”.
Sound advice on rabbit control, ie control of blackberry and gorse which provides ground cover for rabbits. Also use of chemicals and sealing warrens that can’t be destroyed by ploughing.

results.title: The Destruction of St. Patrick's College 1971
results.brief_description: The old St Patrick’s College was demolished to make way for an ecclesiastic office building. Professor Hartley Gratten, of the University of Texas considers, against the background of the demolition by Whelan the Wrecker, why Australians ignore their national heritage.

results.title: Destruction Derby
results.brief_description: In this animated fable with no narration, a caveman builds a car and soon the whole planet is overrun with cars, trucks and airplanes and the air choked with polluting fumes. The imaginative cartoon focuses on one aspect of destruction to the environment and offers a tongue-in-cheek solution - send all cars off in a rocket, into outer space.

results.title: Despotism
results.brief_description: This is the companion piece to the film, “Democracy”. It presents the abstract thesis that power concentrated in the hands of a few, who thus control the means of communication and are able to slant economic distribution in their own favour, and restricted respect of one’s fellow men, are two of the important characteristics of despotism.
